2. Six Retributions, Part 2: 1. General Statement
What are the six retributions? Ä€nanda! All sentient beings create karma with the six consciousnesses, and the evil retributions they attract come out from the six sense organs.
Since creating karma comes from the six sense organs, receiving retribution also returns to the six sense organs. Cause and effect intersect, so it is called intersecting retribution.
Moreover, when one sense organ receives retribution, it goes through all six sense organs, and each sense organ is like this, so it is called intersecting retribution.
Here, it says the six consciousnesses create karma, which is based on the general characteristics.
Karma means to attract and respond. It is both general and specific.
If it can be the leading karma, and wholesome or unwholesome volition attracts and responds to the future neutral eighth consciousness result, then it is the general retribution karma;
If it is the fulfilling karma, and the seeds of volition of the three natures attract and respond to the future results of suffering, happiness, etc., it is called specific retribution karma.
The sixth consciousness creates both general and specific retribution karma;

If the first five consciousnesses only assist in manifesting individual retributions, they cannot manifest the general [retribution], because of two differences: being strong and vigorous, and being subordinate.

translated: As for coming out from the six sense organs, the six sense organs are the tools used to create karma, so since creation follows the sense organs, so too does the experience of retribution. Therefore, it comes out from the sense organs.
Second, distinguishing the six:
First, the retribution of seeing, two parts:
First, seeing the realm at the time of death.
How does evil retribution come out from the six sense organs?
First, the retribution of seeing attracts evil results.

When this seeing karma is about to end, one first sees fierce flames filling the worlds in the ten directions. The consciousness of the deceased flies and falls, riding on the smoke, entering the AvÄ«ci Hell. Two aspects become manifest:
The eye sense organ creates offenses, which is seeing karma. Seeing the realm at the time of death is the retribution and the interaction with karma.
Because the eye sense organ grasps forms, and forms can control the mind to create various karmas, one thus sees fierce flames filling the worlds in the ten directions.
The consciousness follows the fire into the hells to experience retribution.
Second, the karmic retribution of the five sense organs.
First, in the light one sees various evil things and gives rise to immeasurable fear;
second, in the dark one sees nothing and gives rise to immeasurable terror.
Thus, seeing fire burns hearing and becomes boiling hot water and molten copper;
it burns breath and becomes black smoke and purple flames;ğŸ”½it burns taste and becomes burning iron pellets and iron gruel;
it burns touch and becomes hot ashes and furnace charcoal;
it burns the mind and gives rise to sparks that scatter and swirl in the realm of space.
The two sense objects of light and dark are what the eyes grasp. Light can be distinguished, so one sees evil appearances;
in the dark there is no discrimination, one just gives rise to fear.

Thus, it goes through all six sense organs. However, there is primary and secondary. The primary is due to the eye faculty giving rise to consciousness and creating karma, so it goes through the eyes first.
This is not explained here, because the text is abbreviated. The following text will be complete.
Here, fire is the main instrument of suffering, and as it passes through the other faculties, it transforms into unpleasant objects according to the faculties.
Second, the retribution of hearing, in two parts:
First, seeing the realm at the time of death.
Second, the retribution of hearing attracts evil consequences.

When this hearing karma is about to end, first one sees billowing waves submerging heaven and earth. The consciousness of the deceased descends and rides the current into the AvÄ«ci Hell. Two manifestations appear:
Sound can agitate the ocean of the mind, like waves and billows.
Because one grasps this to create karma, at the time of death one first sees this.
Descends means flowing downward.
Second, riding karma to receive retribution.
First, when hearing is opened, one hears various noises, and the spirit becomes confused and agitated;
Second, when hearing is closed, there is silence and nothing to hear, and the dark soul sinks and drowns.
In this way, when the waves of hearing pour into hearing, they can accuse and question;
If it enters the eyes, it can cause thunder, roaring, and evil poisonous vapors;
If it enters the breath, it can cause rain, fog, and poisonous insects to cover the entire body;
If it enters taste, it can cause pus, blood, and various impurities;
If it enters touch, it can cause animals, ghosts, feces, and urine;
If it enters thought, it can cause lightning and hail to crush the spirit.
The two realms of movement and stillness taken by the ear faculty create various karmas, and now experiencing their retributions is also based on these two.
Opening is movement, closing is stillness.
In this way, it goes through the faculties and experiences separately.
In this text, there are discrepancies in matching the faculties with their objects, which may be due to the Sanskrit text being reversed, and the translator not carefully examining it.

Thunder, roaring, and poisonous vapors are not taken by the eyes, rain, fog, and poisonous insects are not objects of the nose, the rest of the text is in order, the wise should examine it themselves.
Third, the retribution of smell, in two parts:
First, seeing the realms at the time of death.
Third, the retribution of smelling attracts evil consequences.

When this smelling karma is about to end, first one sees poisonous gas filling the far and near, and the consciousness of the deceased emerges from the ground and enters the AvÄ«ci Hell, manifesting two aspects:

The nose faculty commits offenses by greedily smelling various fragrances, the bodily parts of sentient beings, and the fragrances of men and women, creating various karmas, thus attracting poisonous gas to experience the retribution.
Second, the karma of riding is experienced and received.
First, penetrating hearing is pervaded by evil qi, causing the mind to be agitated;
Second, obstructed hearing is blocked by qi, causing one to faint on the ground.
In this way, smelling qi can become substance and footing when it strikes the breath;
When it strikes sight, it can become fire and torches;
When it strikes hearing, it can become drowning, submersion, boiling, and bubbling;
When it strikes taste, it can become dull and confused;
If it collides with the sense of touch, it can cause bursting, rotting, and becoming a large mountain of flesh with hundreds of thousands of eyes, being gnawed by countless creatures.
If it collides with the sense of thought, it can cause ashes, miasmas, and flying sand and gravel to strike and shatter the body.
The two aspects of obstruction and passage are the objects perceived by the nose. Based on this, one creates karma and experiences suffering, so there are two aspects.
In this way, the following sections discuss the different experiences of each sense organ.ğŸ”½To be solid and to be permeable means to be obstructed and to be unobstructed.
To be spoiled and to be confused means that spoiled fish are rotten.
Confusion means deviation.
The rest of the text can be understood.
Fourth, the retribution of taste, in two parts:
First, seeing the realms at the time of death.
Fourth, the retribution of taste attracts evil consequences.

When this karma of taste is about to end, one first sees an iron net with raging flames spreading and covering the world. The consciousness of the dying person penetrates downward, hangs upside down on the net, and its head enters the AvÄ«ci Hell. Two aspects become apparent:
The tongue faculty commits the most extensive crimes:
One, craving flavors leads to many killings;

Two, initiating speech to create karma, the crimes are even more extensive. Compared to the other faculties, false speech, frivolous speech, divisive speech, and harsh speech are the most extensive, thus one experiences the iron net covering the world.
Second, the karma and retribution of the tongue faculty:
First, inhaling forms cold ice that freezes and splits the body and flesh;
Second, exhaling becomes fierce flames that scorch and rot the bones and marrow.
Thus, tasting flavors, if experienced through the tongue, one can endure and tolerate;
If experienced through the eyes, one can burn gold and stone;
If experienced through the ears, one can become sharp weapons;
If experienced through the breath, one can become a great iron cage covering the country;
If experienced through the body, one can become bows, arrows, crossbows, and projectiles;
If experienced through thought, one can become flying hot iron falling from the sky.
When inhaling, it attracts the consequences of taste; when exhaling, it gives rise to speech.
In this way, it goes through the other sense faculties and experiences them separately.
To endure and accept means to endure and accept all bad tastes.

When creating karma, first the tongue faculty experiences food and knows the taste, and then it benefits the great elements of the other faculties. If the tongue does not experience taste, the other faculties are not benefited. The experience of retribution is also like this.
Fifth, the retribution of touch, in two parts:
First, seeing the realms at the end of life.
Fifth, the retribution of touch attracts evil consequences.

When this karma of touch is about to end, first one sees four mountains coming together from all sides, with no way out. The dying person's consciousness sees a great iron city, with fire snakes, fire dogs, tigers, wolves, lions, ox-headed guards, and horse-headed rÄká¹£asas holding spears and javelins, driving them into the city gates towards the AvÄ«ci hell. Two manifestations appear:

The body faculty is the cause of many offenses, such as the touch of men and women's sexual desire and love, greedily attached to smoothness and softness, and experiencing cold and heat according to the season, thus experiencing things like the mountains coming together.
Second, the karma of the two vehicles and the retribution they receive.
First, the touch of coming together, the mountains coming together and pressing the body, the bones, flesh, and blood collapsing;
Second, the touch of separation, the swords touching the body, the heart and liver being torn apart.
In this way, the touch of coming together, when experienced through touch, can be a path, a contemplation, a court, or an office;
When experienced through sight, it can be burning and hot;ğŸ”½When experienced through hearing, it can be banging, striking, stabbing, or shooting;
When experienced through breath, it can be binding, bagging, roasting, or binding;
When experienced through taste, it can be plowing, pinching, cutting, or slicing;
When experienced through thought, it can be falling, flying, boiling, or roasting.
What the body takes is only coming together and separation, creating offenses from them, and the resulting retribution is also like this.
In this way, it goes down through the different faculties and receives [different punishments].
The Dao, Guan, Ting, and An are all places for punishing crimes.
The rest of the text can be understood.
Sixth, the retribution of thoughts, in two parts:
First, seeing the realms at the time of death.
Sixth, the retribution of thoughts, which attracts evil consequences.

When this karma of thoughts is about to end, before death one first sees evil winds destroying the country. The consciousness of the deceased is blown up into the sky, spins down and rides the wind, falling into the AvÄ«ci Hell. Two manifestations appear:
Thoughts are mental karma, without substance and swift like the wind, so it attracts this retribution.
Second, riding the karma to receive retribution.
First, if one is not aware, and delusion is extreme, then one runs about without rest;
Second, if one is aware and not deluded, then the suffering is immeasurable, with intense burning pain difficult to endure.
In this way, wrong thoughts, when thoughts are bound, can be the standard or the object;
When views are bound, they can be the mirror or the evidence;
If you bind hearing, you can become a large conjoined rock, ice, frost, earth, or mist.
If you bind breath, you can become a large fire carriage, fire boat, or fire cage.
If you bind taste, you can become a great wailing, regret, or weeping.
If you bind touch, you can become large or small, be born and die ten thousand times in a day, be overturned or turned over.
The two dusts of arising and ceasing that the mind's objects give rise to can also follow the five to clearly grasp objects.

If you are not aware, you will be affected by desolation, loneliness, and distraction. If you are not confused and aware of suffering, it is due to clarity. All of this is due to creating karma through deviant thoughts.
In this way, the following is the separate experience of the faculties.
The location is the place where suffering is experienced.
The mirror and evidence are the evidence of past crimes.

Although one root undergoes retribution, it extends to the other roots, yet the roots correspond to the instruments of suffering, some are immediate and some are not, and it is not necessarily the case that each root and object correspond. Learners should follow the text to understand it, and should not doubt it.
Third, concluding and clarifying again, there are three parts:
First, concluding that it is false.
Ä€nanda!
This is called the ten causes and six effects of hell, all of which are created by sentient beings' deluded confusion.
Falsely creating karma and falsely experiencing retribution are all like empty flowers, yet the causes and effects have never been contrary.
Second, specifically clarifying the heavy and light.
If sentient beings create evil karma together, they will enter AvÄ«ci Hell and experience immeasurable suffering for immeasurable kalpas.
If the six roots and ten causes are complete and they create karma together, they will enter AvÄ«ci Hell, which is the great hell of uninterrupted suffering with five aspects complete.
If the six faculties each commit [evil deeds], and the deeds they create involve both objects and faculties, then such a person will enter the eight uninterrupted hells.
Just as the sixth consciousness is like the eye consciousness, only taking its own objects, involving the faculties in its actions, not engaging other faculties, and not possessing the ten causes,
this means that the six faculties are complete in their creation, only creating at the time without involving other faculties, entering the eight hot hells, next lightest than the previous.
If the three of body, speech, and mind commit killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct, then such a person will enter the eighteen hells.
Body, speech, and mind are three of the six faculties.
Killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct are three of the ten causes.
If the body fully commits the three offenses of killing and so forth, and speech and mind do not commit them, it is lighter than the previous, and one enters the eighteen hells.
If the three karmas are not combined, and one occasionally commits one killing or one stealing, then such a person will enter the thirty-six hells.
If one alone commits an act such as killing without involving other offenses, one enters the thirty-six hells, and it is also lighter than the previous case.
If one sees and sees with a single faculty, and commits a single offense, this person will enter the one hundred and eight hells.
This is lighter than the previous case of committing a single killing with a single faculty, and one enters the one hundred and eight hells.
If in the mind there is wrong thought or incorrect views that have not yet taken form in body or speech,
or if one kills a person with the mouth while the body and mind are neutral,
these are all light.
As for seeing and seeing, seeing is the present sound. It means only seeing with a single faculty, not involving other faculties, so it says seeing and seeing.
Third, concluding the answer to the question.
Thus, sentient beings create their own individual karmas, and enter the same realm in the world. Deluded thoughts arise, and they are not originally existent.
It means that because the three karmas are not severed, each has its own private [karma], so it says create their own individual karmas.

Because of each person's private [actions], the many private [actions] are the same, therefore it is said entering the same realm. It refers to the same karma that produces the same results, and different karma that produces different results. Therefore, the previous text says within the same realm, there is also the original ground.
All arise from deluded thoughts, therefore they are not originally existent.
Second, the realm of ghosts, in three parts:
First, a general statement.
Furthermore, Ananda!

These sentient beings, who do not violate the precepts, break the bodhisattva precepts, or slander the Buddha's nirvana, will experience the burning of various karmas for kalpas, and then, after the karmic retribution is exhausted, they will receive various ghost forms.
Not violating the precepts means slandering the absence of precepts.
Breaking the bodhisattva precepts means not restraining the light and heavy [precepts].
Slandering the Buddha's nirvana means not believing in cause and effect.
These all sever the roots of goodness, and the remaining karmas can be known.
Since they are long punished in hell, it is said the burning of various karmas for kalpas.
They then take rebirth in other types of ghosts, thus entering the ghost realm.
The ten types of ghosts are due to the previous ten causes. The direct retribution for the ten causes has already been explained in the previous text.
The extreme suffering and mutual harm are not light experiences, thus it says later, after the crimes are exhausted, they receive the forms of various ghosts.
Second, specifically revealing.
If in the original cause, greed for objects is the crime, this person, after the crimes are exhausted, encounters objects to form a shape, and is called a strange ghost.
This is the cause of greedy habits.

Giving rise to greed for objects, taking them unjustly, the remaining retribution is in the ghosts, still relying on objects, namely the spirits of gold, silver, grass, and trees, their types are not one, thus it is called a strange ghost.
The direct experience of suffering retribution is in the cold ice hells.
Greed for form is the crime. This person, after the crimes are exhausted, encounters wind to form a shape, and is called a drought ghost.
This is the cause of previous lustful habits.
Form can agitate the body and mind, like wind stirring objects, the retribution attracts a ghost body, and it still relies on wind.
The essence of wind is originally empty, caused by habitual tendencies.
Cause and effect correspond to each other, how could it be in vain?
Those who commit crimes out of greed and delusion, after their crimes are exhausted, encounter animals and take on animal forms, becoming ghost-possessors.
This is the previous cause of deceitful habits.

Because of deceitful falsity, relying on emptiness to deceive, they attach to animals and immediately form ghost-forms, such as foxes, pigs, dogs with strange spiritual powers, their types are not one, therefore it is said that encountering animals they take on animal forms.
Ghost-possessors manifest beautiful forms to deceive people.
Those who commit crimes out of greed and resentment, after their crimes are exhausted, encounter insects and take on insect forms, becoming poison-gu ghosts.
This is the previous cause of resentful habits.

Due to anger as the precursor, harboring malice without letting go, tying resentment in the mind, with heat and distress in the heart, when receiving the remaining retribution they also rely on poisonous types, such as snakes, vipers, poisonous insects with spiritual powers, becoming poison-gu ghosts.
Those who commit crimes through greedy thoughts, when their crimes are exhausted, encounter calamities and form shapes, are called plague ghosts.
This is the cause of the previous anger habit.
In suffering and the instruments of suffering, they harbor hatred, or because of jealousy and resentment they give rise to anger, and do not abandon their anger, called greedy thoughts.
When they receive the ghost retribution, they enter the bodies of those who encounter disasters and calamities, called plague ghosts.
This includes poisonous plagues, traumatic fevers, corpse-borne infections, and bone-steam illnesses, all of which are created by these ghosts.
Those who commit crimes through greedy arrogance, when their crimes are exhausted, encounter qi and form shapes, are called hungry ghosts.
This is the cause of the previous pride habit.
Pride is to overpower others and be arrogant towards things, to be self-important and forceful.

When they receive the ghost destiny, they encounter qi to form their substance, inwardly lacking true virtue, with an empty stomach and a haughty mind, suffering from hunger and starvation, thus called hungry ghosts.
Those who commit crimes through greedy deception, when their crimes are exhausted, encounter the dark and form shapes, are called nightmare ghosts.
This is the cause of the previous habit of deception.
In order to obtain profit and praise, one harbors many different schemes, falsely displaying virtue and deceiving others, causing others to be confused and not understand one's affairs.
When one receives a ghost body, relying on the dark and mysterious, one confuses those who sleep. Therefore, it is called the ghost of sleep paralysis.
Greed for illumination is a crime. When this person's crimes are exhausted, they encounter essence and become a form, called the ghost of monsters.
This is the cause of the habit of seeing.
Those born with different views each have their own enlightened understanding, giving rise to mutual opposition, developing into defiance and rejection.

When they attract the ghost realm, they encounter places of bright essence and take that as their form. They rely on the essence and radiance of the sun, moon, stars, mountains, and marshes to form their bodies.
As for the word monsters, it refers to strange transformations in water and rocks.
Greed for completion is a crime. When this person's crimes are exhausted, they encounter brightness and become a form, called the ghost of servants.
This is the cause of the habit of oppression.
Oppressing and humiliating the innocent, exhausting the mind and thoughts, harming the innocent, causing them to become guilty.
Encountering obvious realms, relying on them to form a body, not belonging to the dark and obscure category.
Running errands, fighting in battles, carrying sand, and bearing stones, and so forth, therefore called servants.
Greedy and partisan for crimes, when the person's crimes are exhausted, they encounter humans to form a body, named the ghost of transmission.
This is the cause of litigious habits.

Covering up one's own crimes, being accused by others, the retribution is in the ghost category, relying on a human body, like the world having child teachers and shamans, all using the divine way to transmit the words of misfortune, good fortune, and blessings and curses, named the ghost of transmission.
The number of these above ghost types is indeed numerous, but investigating the fruits and causes, they are no more than these ten.
Third, concluding.
Ä€nanda!
These people all fall due to pure emotions, and the fire of karma dries them up, emerging above as ghosts.
All of these are attracted by one's own deluded karma. If one awakens to bodhi, then the wondrous and perfect clarity is originally non-existent.
The ten causes and six retributions are all created by pure emotions. Since emotions sink downward, one falls into hell.
Hell punishes for a long time, and when emotions are exhausted, one ascends. Therefore, it is said that the karma fire burns dry and one emerges as a ghost.
The ghost mind is light and agitated, and the remaining karma fire attracts one's own deluded karma, not obtained from others.
In the bodhi mind, all are like empty flowers.
Third, the realm of animals, in three parts:
First, a general statement.
Furthermore, Ananda!

When the karma of ghosts is exhausted, both emotions and thoughts become empty. One then encounters in the world those with whom one has a karmic debt, and one is born as an animal to repay the past debts.
Hell punishes emotions, the ghost realm punishes thoughts. Since emotions and thoughts are exhausted, it is said to become empty.
However, what is being emptied is the karma produced by the emotions and thoughts.
When the karma of the two paths is gone, one is reborn as an animal to repay past debts, using one's body and life to repay others.
If one is in another category, one should correspond accordingly.
Second, the specific manifestations.
The ghosts of strange creatures, when the creatures are exhausted, their retribution ends, and they are reborn in the world, often becoming owls.
The greedy habit becomes a strange ghost, and when the retribution ends, it becomes an owl.
An owl is a ground owl, which lays eggs on a lump of earth. It is caused by greed for objects, and all strange creatures are included in this category.
The ghosts of wind-evaporating demons, when the wind evaporates, their retribution ends, and they are reborn in the world, often becoming ominous signs and all kinds of strange creatures.
Lustful habits become the cause, and the retribution attracts wind-evaporating demons, which become animals and receive inauspicious signs.
A fault is a transgression.
A sign is a response.
The calamities and anomalies that will be brought about by evil deeds have already manifested in advance.
Like a flock of sparrows and a multitude of rats are signs of famine, a swallow flying means water disasters, and a dancing crane means much drought, there are many such cases.
The ghost that possesses animals, when the animal dies and the retribution is exhausted, it is reborn in the world and often becomes a fox.
The retribution of deceit causes one to become a ghost that possesses, when the host is exhausted, one receives the body of an animal.
The ghost of poisonous insects, when the insects are destroyed and the retribution is exhausted, it is reborn in the world and often becomes a poisonous creature.
The retribution of the habit of resentment causes ghosts to create poisonous insects, and animals to become poisonous creatures, such as vipers, scorpions, and centipedes.
The ghost of decline and pestilence, when the decline is exhausted and the retribution is exhausted, it is reborn in the world and often becomes a parasite.

The cause of the habit of anger causes ghosts to bring about decline and pestilence, relying on disasters and calamities to enter the body, and then to transform and receive an animal form that still relies on the body, becoming a parasite or tapeworm.
Ghosts that receive qi: When the qi is exhausted, the retribution ends and they are born in the world, mostly becoming food.
Hungry ghosts attach to qi. Arrogance is the cause. Ghosts experience hunger and emptiness. Animals fill others' bellies. Therefore, they become food. They are the edible animals in the world.
Ghosts that dwell in darkness: When the darkness is exhausted, the retribution ends and they are born in the world, mostly becoming clothing.

Past causes and deceptive habits. Ghosts cause nightmares. When yin and yang are exhausted, animals become clothing. They are the kind that are ridden, such as donkeys, cows, horses, and silkworms. They are used by people as clothing.
Womb means dense and secretive, not clear or exposed.
Ghosts that harmonize with essence: When the harmony is exhausted, the retribution ends and they are born in the world, mostly becoming responsive.
The cause is the habit of seeing. Ghosts become monsters. When the essence and radiance are exhausted, animals become responsive. They are the ones that respond to the changing seasons and sing.
Harmony means mixed. It is created by mixing with refined essence and becomes a ghost.
The ghosts of bright spirits, when the brightness is extinguished and the retribution is exhausted, are born in the world and often bring auspicious signs of all kinds.

This is the previous practice of injustice. Ghosts rely on brightness to be born and become servants. When the karma of the ghost realm is exhausted, they receive the retribution of animals as auspicious signs.

Auspicious means beautiful. When good fortune is about to arrive, there are premonitory signs. This is due to being summoned by the beautiful practices of others. It refers to the kinds such as the qilin and phoenix.
The ghosts that rely on people, when the person dies and the retribution is exhausted, are born in the world and often follow the same kind.
The cause of the practice of litigation leads ghosts to become messengers. When people die, they become animals. The retribution is in their cleverness, so it is said to follow the same kind.
It refers to the kinds that are raised by people and follow them.
Third, concluding the teaching, in two parts:
First, directly concluding the falsity.
Ä€nanda!

All of these are due to the fire of karma drying up and repaying their past debts, and becoming animals on the side. These are also all attracted by their own false karma. If they awaken to bodhi, then this false condition originally does not exist at all.

After the fire of karma has burned up the two destinies of hell and hungry ghosts, the emotions and thoughts dry up, and now they become animals to repay the remaining karma, so it is said they become animals on the side.
Because of false thoughts, there is [the appearance of] the nature of enlightenment, which is originally nonexistent, just like a circular shadow seen because of an eye disease.
Second, citing the question to reiterate.

As you have said, the evil karma of those such as Jewel Fragrance, King VirÅ«á¸haka, and the monk Sunaká¹£atra, all arose from their own minds and did not descend from heaven, emerge from the earth, or be given by others. They were attracted by their own delusions and now they themselves experience the results. In the mind of bodhi, all of this is floating and illusory, solidified false thoughts.
The three conditions asked about are each created by the false karma of those people themselves, and do not come from others, so it is said they are not naturally caused by heaven, etc.
Falsely created and falsely experienced, in the nature of enlightenment they are all like empty flowers.
Fourth, the human realm, in three parts:
First, a general explanation, in two parts:
First, repaying the remainder and returning to demand interest.
Furthermore, Ananda!
From these animals repaying old debts, if the repayer exceeds the amount repaid, these beings will then return to being human and demand back the remainder.

Exceeding means going beyond the proper amount, acting in excess without following the original amount, referring to unreasonable harsh labor regardless of its lightness or heaviness, or working day and night without rest, or eating to excess.
Such types all correspond to demanding back the remainder.

Now, those who rely on their noble status to indulge themselves, who rely on their power and influence to be extravagant, who greedily take their strength to exploit them, who take their taste to unjustly kill them, who do not spare the morning and evening, who do not understand the toil and hardship, when their blessings are exhausted and they are charged with the remainder, how could this be appropriate?
If they have strength and also have blessings and virtues, then among humans they do not abandon their human bodies to repay that strength.
If they are without blessings, they return to being animals to repay the remaining cost.
Those who cultivate goodness and promote blessings only repay that strength in their human bodies.

Now, it is seen that in families that accumulate goodness, wealth and possessions are often depleted, either through robbery and theft, or through being in debt, or through unjustly suffering forced labor, or through unjustly receiving beatings. All of this is due to past karma, which should be repaid by abandoning this body to be an animal. Because of cultivating blessings, it is slightly repaid in the human realm;
if one becomes an animal, it is completely without goodness.
Second, repaying karmic debts is difficult to stop.
Ananda, you should know that if one uses money or forces them to work, the debt is paid off and ends.
If in the meantime one kills their life or eats their flesh, in this way, even for as many kalpas as there are atoms, they will continue to eat each other and kill each other.
It is like a wheel turning, each becoming high and low, without rest, except for shamatha and the appearance of a Buddha, it cannot be stopped.
You owe others money, and they owe you strength. Now that you have repaid the debt, the repayment ends. This is like the world raising cows and horses.

If you still kill them and eat their flesh, this then turns into killing karma. Body to body, life to life, you take from each other and repay each other. As humans eat sheep, sheep die and become humans, taking turns to blame each other, without rest.
Among all karmas, killing life is the heaviest. If one does not encounter the appearance of a Buddha and cultivate shamatha, one will definitely not be able to stop it.
Second, the specific explanation.
You should now know that those in the owl class, after repaying their debts, restore their forms and are reborn among humans, mixed in with the dull class.
Because of greed for objects, ghosts possess strange forms, and animals are attached to owl pellets and raise them.

As for the term mixed in with, when humans receive retribution, it is due to wholesome causes. Although the general retribution is the same, the full karmic results are different, so they are divided into ten types.

Now those coming from the animal realm are the remaining karmic results received indirectly, not due to the wholesome karmic results that attract them. Those in the class of omens, after repaying their debts, restore their forms and are reborn among humans, mixed in with the foolish class.
Initially due to greed and desire, ghosts receive the form of a demon, and above they are animals that respond to disasters and misfortunes.
When their karma is exhausted, they return to their original state and are included in the category of fools. Those with much desire do not practice other good deeds, but only focus on one object.
Because they do not practice good deeds, they are reborn as fools.
The difference between stubborn and foolish is that stubborn means knowing that good deeds do not follow, and being unwilling to accept instruction.
Foolish means being in a daze of darkness, with dull consciousness and difficulty in understanding. This is the only difference.
As for those in the fox category, when their retribution is exhausted, they regain their original form and are reborn among humans, but are included in the category of stubborn people.
Because of the habit of deceit, ghosts become fox spirits, and are included in the category of animals, such as foxes and wolves.
Now, as human beings, they are included in the category of stubborn and self-willed people who do not accept advice.
As for those in the poisonous category, when their retribution is exhausted, they regain their original form and are reborn among humans, but are included in the category of ordinary people.
The cause is the habit of resentment. Ghosts become poisonous creatures, and as animals, they take the form of snakes and scorpions.
When reborn as humans, they are mixed in with the ordinary people, which refers to the vulgar and coarse-natured ones.
As for those in the ghost realm who have repaid their debts and restored their forms, they are reborn among humans and mixed with the lowly class.

Humans become weak, probably due to arrogant self-importance, which in turn attracts the retribution of weakness and cowardice.
As for those in the hungry ghost realm who have repaid their debts and restored their forms, they are reborn among humans and mixed with the laboring class.
The cause of deception leads to ghosts from dark nightmares, animals becoming clothing and accessories.
Humans experience hard work, difficult physical labor, and crafts.
As for those in the animal realm who have repaid their debts and restored their forms, they are reborn among humans and mixed with the literate class.
Because of following the habits of seeing, ghosts fall into the category of spirits, and after the retribution of monsters ends, they become animals that respond to the times.
They participate in the human realm, slightly having literary talent, but not the cause of correct practice, thus it is said they participate in a mixture.
Those who have repaid their debts and restored their forms are born in the human realm and participate in the category of the enlightened.
Because of the practice of litigation, ghosts receive the enlightenment of spirits, driving and racing without a moment's rest, and animals attract auspicious responses.
Humans are mixed with intelligence. Examining the effect from the cause, there is definitely no error.
Those who have repaid their debts and restored their forms are born in the human realm and participate in the category of the enlightened.
Because of the practice of litigation, ghosts rely on people, transmitting spiritual words, revealing blessings and misfortunes, and animals attract obedient intelligence.
Humans understand prosperity and decline, and are not surprised by honor and disgrace. They are at ease and self-satisfied, thus called the enlightened category.

In the hells, among ghosts and animals, repaying past karma, when the retribution of the three paths is exhausted, they are reborn in the human body again, in accordance with the good karma of the later stage, and are further divided into ten types. All of this is the inverted revolving.
In order to stop the inversion, there are only precepts, concentration, and wisdom. Without these three, the revolving does not cease.
If the Buddha does not appear in the world, who will expound this Dharma, enabling them to cultivate and study, and escape the revolving?

Preserving thoughts and solidifying the body means keeping the mind on longevity and immortality, so that this body becomes solid and indestructible.
Separately cultivating false thoughts refers to the ten methods of cultivation below.

These are all with outflows. In progress, they are not as good as the heavens, but in decline, they are superior to humans. Therefore, they dwell in mountains and forests that humans cannot reach, called the realm of immortals.

Spells and prohibitions are precisely the dao techniques of immortals, using these to maintain the body, prolonging and solidifying it, the power of the techniques accomplished, is called the path of dao.
